Author: Decker#3767
Content:
i'm modified a pool to include in block only 5 txes (4 txes + 1 coinbase) from mempool, to get short hex block to analyse. example of produced block:
https://gist.github.com/DeckerSU/aa80df1719c0eac0ee5d5e9fc256a1ea
pool software counts that daemon accept this block, but in real - this block don't appears on network. when i tried to submit this block manually again - daemon returns "duplicate-invalid" ... that means that block already known to daemon and it's invalid.

seems, if we understand why daemon count this block as invalid - problem will be solved.

Author: Decker#3767
Content: @jl777c seems all nomp based software affected ... if mempool have more than 0x7F (127) txes - every mined block will fail, bcz seems it have incorrect `varint` encoding. when chain is stalled earlier - we have more than 170 txes in mempool. but to be sure at 100% - i'll need to write some additional code and try to reproduce it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is horrible bug!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and why 127 and not 255

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: wrong on many levels

Author: Decker#3767
Content: need additional tests ... want to be sure that it's varint encoding related ...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then a short term fix is to limit to 100 tx per block?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: @Decker if that's so then it has to be a 127 limit **and** something else; I used this solo before with over 10k txes in mempool

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I feel like I've stratum mined blocks with >127 txs in them on other chains

Author: Decker#3767
Content: Still investigating ... i assume that for 2500 txes in mempool, for example, all will be ok ... because 2500 in hex is a 2 bytes - 0x9C4 (C409) ... but if txes count is in 128..255 - it will fail.

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: hmm

Author: Decker#3767
Content: For 2 bytes txcount - should be FDxxyy ... and in case of 176 txes in mempool we have FDB0 instead of FDB000 ...

Content: Remember, chain stuck at moment when we have 176 txes in mempool ...
